answers.answer: Hi,Are there other signs and symptoms present? Was there a previous operation or injury to this area? This can be a urogenital fistula that between the bladder and the vagina. This could be due to a previous injury, infection, diabetes, arteriosclerosis, endometriosis or anatomic distortion by myomas.  It would be best to see you gynecologist for proper evaluation and management. Take care and keep us posted..

question: I'm female, 44, this is a new problem. I recently found a very small hole about a half inch away from my urethra. I had been having sharp stabbing pains for a few months, but no signs or symptoms of infection. I have found nothing on the web about this subject. Any help would be appreciated.
title: Second hole next to urethra
